title: Dan McKee
added: On January 7, 2021, President-elect [[Joe Biden]] selected Rhode Island Governor [[Gina Raimondo]] as his choice for [[United States Secretary of Commerce|Secretary of Commerce]]. Should Raimondo be confirmed by the [[United States Senate]], as is expected, McKee will become [[Governor of Rhode Island]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/07/business/economy/gina-raimondo-commerce-secretary.html|title=Biden Picks Rhode Island Governor for Commerce Secretary|website=@nytimes|language=en|access-date=2021-1-7}}</ref>

title: Dan McKee
added: McKee was an officer of McKee Brothers, a heating, air conditioning, and home heating oil delivery business founded by his grandfather.<ref name="Randal">{{cite news |last=Edgar |first=Randal |date=August 24, 2014 |title=Democrats in R.I. lieutenant governor race put economy first |url=https://www.providencejournal.com/article/20140824/News/308249995?template=ampart |work=[[The Providence Journal]] |location=Providence, RI}}</ref> In addition, he ran a health and fitness business for more than 30 years.<ref name="Randal"/>

title: Dan McKee
added: On January 7, 2021, President-elect [[Joe Biden]] selected Rhode Island Governor [[Gina Raimondo]] as his choice for [[United States Secretary of Commerce|Secretary of Commerce]]. Raimondo was confirmed by the [[United States Senate]] on March 2, 2021,<ref>https://www.npr.org/sections/president-biden-takes-office/2021/03/02/962856664/bidens-commerce-secretary-gina-raimondo-confirmed-by-senate</ref> and McKee became the 76th [[Governor of Rhode Island]], upon Raimondo's resignation later that day.<ref>https://www.providencejournal.com/story/news/politics/2021/03/02/ri-may-have-new-governor-today-heres-how-would-happen/6883302002/</ref>

title: Dan McKee
added: In February 2021, McKee began to form a [[COVID-19]] advisory board in anticipation whenever he would become Rhode Island's governor.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/2021/02/03/metro/mckee-names-covid-19-advisory-group/|title=McKee names COVID advisory board|publisher=Boston Globe|date=February 3, 2021}}</ref> He had criticized the Raimondo administration over a slow COVID-19 vaccine rollout.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wpri.com/news/politics-government/mckee-criticizes-raimondo-administration-over-vaccine-rollout/|title=McKee criticizes Raimondo administration over vaccine rollout|publisher=WPRI|accessdate=3 March 2021}}<?ref>

title: Dan McKee
added: In February 2021, McKee began to form a [[COVID-19]] advisory board in anticipation whenever he would become Rhode Island's governor.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/2021/02/03/metro/mckee-names-covid-19-advisory-group/|title=McKee names COVID advisory board|publisher=Boston Globe|date=February 3, 2021}}</ref> He had criticized the Raimondo administration over a slow COVID-19 vaccine rollout.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wpri.com/news/politics-government/mckee-criticizes-raimondo-administration-over-vaccine-rollout/|title=McKee criticizes Raimondo administration over vaccine rollout|publisher=WPRI|accessdate=3 March 2021}}</ref>
